titles.title: Continuing Appropriations resolution FY2006 (Second)
Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2006, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 558 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 72 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Sec. 2. House Resolution 542 is laid on the table. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 558.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 72 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Sec. 2. House Resolution 542 is laid on the table. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 72.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on adoption of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Lewis (CA) demanded the yeas and nays. The Chair announced that the yeas and nays were ordered and subsequently postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the joint resolution until later in the legislative day.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 413 - 16 (Roll no. 599).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 11/19/2005--Public Law. Amends Public Law 109-77 to extend until December 17, 2005, specified continuing appropriations for FY2006.
